pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw: yes, we have 6.7.0 version in our repository. If we want to go with dart 6.8.0 it is ok but we need to upload it, modify these dependencies and rebuild the binaries.
content.html: yes, we have 6.7.0 version in our repository. If we want to go with dart 6.8.0 it is ok but we need to upload it, modify these dependencies and rebuild the binaries.

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw: I'm just pointing out that this blocks people from installing a newer version of dart, which may have bug fixes. Even if they manage to install a consistent set of packages, it would cause libignition-physics-dartsim-dev to be uninstalled. I just want to confirm that this is the intended result.
content.html: I'm just pointing out that this blocks people from installing a newer version of dart, which may have bug fixes. Even if they manage to install a consistent set of packages, it would cause libignition-physics-dartsim-dev to be uninstalled. I just want to confirm that this is the intended result.

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw: It is not the `intended result` but as a side effect of guarantee packages consistency. Since dart packages uses the same name and are not side-by-side co-installable  these PR change is trying to keep consistency, if someone installs dart-6.8.x packages, ignition-physics-dartsim can not been installed since it’s going to be broken \(that was Nate’s case\).
content.html: It is not the intended result but as a side effect of guarantee packages consistency. Since dart packages uses the same name and are not side-by-side co-installable these PR change is trying to keep consistency, if someone installs dart-6.8.x packages, ignition-physics-dartsim can not been installed since it’s going to be broken (that was Nate’s case).

content.html: Thanks. So, with this change if I have dart-6.8 installed then attempting to install ignition-blueprint will fail? And if I don't have dart installed, then ignition-blueprint will install dart-6.7. Is all of that correct?

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
What's strange is that the `libignition-physics1-dartsim-plugin.so.1` refers to `libdart.so.6.7`, which includes the minor number. All the other dependent libraries (except tinyxml and maybe another) only mention the major version. For example, run`ldd libignition-physics1-dartsim-plugin.so.1` and you see:

```	
        linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007ffc903e8000)
	libdart-collision-ode.so.6.7 => not found
	libdart.so.6.7 => not found
	libassimp.so.4 (0x00007fa9ff191000)
	libsdformat8.so.8 (0x00007fa9fee29000)
	libignition-physics1.so.1 (0x00007fa9fec21000)
	libignition-common3-graphics.so.3 (0x00007fa9fe98e000)
	libignition-common3.so.3 (0x00007fa9fe74c000)
	libignition-math6.so.6 (0x00007fa9fe518000)
	libstdc++.so.6 (0x00007fa9fe18f000)
	libm.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libm.so.6 (0x00007fa9fddf1000)
	libgcc_s.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libgcc_s.so.1 (0x00007fa9fdbd9000)
	libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007fa9fd7e8000)
	libz.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libz.so.1 (0x00007fa9fd5cb000)
	libminizip.so.1 (0x00007fa9fd3c0000)
	librt.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1 (0x00007fa9fd1b8000)
	libtinyxml.so.2.6.2 (0x00007fa9fcfa3000)
	libgts-0.7.so.5 (0x00007fa9fcd46000)
	libfreeimage.so.3 (0x00007fa9fca96000)
	libtinyxml2.so.6 (0x00007fa9fc882000)
	libpthread.so.0 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0 (0x00007fa9fc663000)
	libglib-2.0.so.0 (0x00007fa9fc34c000)
	libdl.so.2 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdl.so.2 (0x00007fa9fc148000)
	libuuid.so.1 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libuuid.so.1 (0x00007fa9fbf41000)
	/lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007faa00034000)
	libjxrglue.so.0 (0x00007fa9fbd21000)
	libjpeg.so.8 (0x00007fa9fbab9000)
	libopenjp2.so.7 (0x00007fa9fb863000)
	libpng16.so.16 (0x00007fa9fb631000)
	libraw.so.16 (0x00007fa9fb35e000)
	libtiff.so.5 (0x00007fa9fb0e7000)
	libwebpmux.so.3 (0x00007fa9faedd000)
	libwebp.so.6 (0x00007fa9fac74000)
	libIlmImf-2_2.so.22 (0x00007fa9fa7b1000)
	libHalf.so.12 (0x00007fa9fa56e000)
	libIex-2_2.so.12 (0x00007fa9fa350000)
	libpcre.so.3 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpcre.so.3 (0x00007fa9fa0de000)
	libjpegxr.so.0 (0x00007fa9f9eaa000)
	liblcms2.so.2 (0x00007fa9f9c52000)
	libgomp.so.1 (0x00007fa9f9a23000)
	liblzma.so.5 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/liblzma.so.5 (0x00007fa9f97fd000)
	libjbig.so.0 (0x00007fa9f95ef000)
```

So, I wonder if it's possible to link against `libdart.so.6` and not `libdart.so.6.7`

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
Now I'm thinking that the problem is upstream in DART. 

Comparing DART's installed cmake config code, I see this (note libdart-collision-ode.so.6.8):

```
set_property(TARGET dart-collision-ode APPEND PROPERTY IMPORTED_CONFIGURATIONS RELWITHDEBINFO)
set_target_properties(dart-collision-ode PROPERTIES
  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELWITHDEBINFO "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdart-collision-ode.so.6.8.4"
  IMPORTED_SONAME_RELWITHDEBINFO "libdart-collision-ode.so.6.8"
  )
```

Compare this to ignition-math (note libignition-math6.so.6) :

```
set_property(TARGET ignition-math6::ignition-math6 APPEND PROPERTY IMPORTED_CONFIGURATIONS RELWITHDEBINFO)
set_target_properties(ignition-math6::ignition-math6 PROPERTIES
  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELWITHDEBINFO "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}/lib/libignition-math6.so.6.2.0"
  IMPORTED_SONAME_RELWITHDEBINFO "libignition-math6.so.6"
  )
```
content.html:
Now I'm thinking that the problem is upstream in DART.

Comparing DART's installed cmake config code, I see this (note libdart-collision-ode.so.6.8):

set_property(TARGET dart-collision-ode APPEND PROPERTY IMPORTED_CONFIGURATIONS RELWITHDEBINFO)
set_target_properties(dart-collision-ode PROPERTIES
  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELWITHDEBINFO "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libdart-collision-ode.so.6.8.4"
  IMPORTED_SONAME_RELWITHDEBINFO "libdart-collision-ode.so.6.8"
  )

Compare this to ignition-math (note libignition-math6.so.6) :

set_property(TARGET ignition-math6::ignition-math6 APPEND PROPERTY IMPORTED_CONFIGURATIONS RELWITHDEBINFO)
set_target_properties(ignition-math6::ignition-math6 PROPERTIES
  IMPORTED_LOCATION_RELWITHDEBINFO "${_IMPORT_PREFIX}/lib/libignition-math6.so.6.2.0"
  IMPORTED_SONAME_RELWITHDEBINFO "libignition-math6.so.6"
  )

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw: It might be sufficient to have someone with dart 6.8 installed to rebuild the ign-physics1 debians. This would allow default users of ubuntu bionic to use ignition gazebo. Is my logic correct here?
content.html: It might be sufficient to have someone with dart 6.8 installed to rebuild the ign-physics1 debians. This would allow default users of ubuntu bionic to use ignition gazebo. Is my logic correct here?

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
The root of the problem is that upstream DART [does not guarantee ABI compatibility between minor versions](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/pull/1239) \([proposal is being discussed](https://github.com/dartsim/dart/issues/1026)\). With this in mind the library installation and names are right for DART \( \*.so.6.7\) what is preventing ABI collision problems \(instead of them we have these “not found” at loader time\).

Our upstream source are also right about having the minimal version specification inside CMakeLists.txt. We support dart 6.8.x builds if people want to build them from source but we need to choose only one ABI for our binaries.

> It might be sufficient to have someone with dart 6.8 installed to rebuild the ign-physics1 debians

I don’t think so. If someone wants to go with dart-6.8.x then he/she can rebuild the ign-physics1 packages but not only these packages. Everything build on top of these new binaries needs to be rebuilt. The only safe path I see is to build everything else from source starting with ign-physics.
content.html:
The root of the problem is that upstream DART does not guarantee ABI compatibility between minor versions (proposal is being discussed). With this in mind the library installation and names are right for DART ( *.so.6.7) what is preventing ABI collision problems (instead of them we have these “not found” at loader time).

Our upstream source are also right about having the minimal version specification inside CMakeLists.txt. We support dart 6.8.x builds if people want to build them from source but we need to choose only one ABI for our binaries.

It might be sufficient to have someone with dart 6.8 installed to rebuild the ign-physics1 debians

I don’t think so. If someone wants to go with dart-6.8.x then he/she can rebuild the ign-physics1 packages but not only these packages. Everything build on top of these new binaries needs to be rebuilt. The only safe path I see is to build everything else from source starting with ign-physics.

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
that is the reason of this PR, enforce the correct version of DART. 

At this point, without this modification you can go with:

* uninstall dart PPA
* apt-get remove .\*dart6.\*
* apt-get update && apt-get install libdart6-dev \(should bring dart6 from our repository\)

If you want to keep dart PPA in place, another solution is to tell apt that you want precedence over DART ppa:

create `/etc/apt/preferences.d/dart:`

```
Package: libdart6*
Pin: origin packages.osrfoundation.org
Pin-Priority: 1001
```

* apt-get remove .\*dart6.\*
* apt-get update && apt-get install libdart6-dev \(should bring dart6 from our repository\)

I’m still unsure about what is apt going to do in a system if we add the changes in this PR and the system also have dart PPA installed but in the worst case should prevent your error.
content.html:
that is the reason of this PR, enforce the correct version of DART.

At this point, without this modification you can go with:

  • uninstall dart PPA
  • apt-get remove .*dart6.*
  • apt-get update && apt-get install libdart6-dev (should bring dart6 from our repository)

If you want to keep dart PPA in place, another solution is to tell apt that you want precedence over DART ppa:

create /etc/apt/preferences.d/dart:

Package: libdart6*
Pin: origin packages.osrfoundation.org
Pin-Priority: 1001
  • apt-get remove .*dart6.*
  • apt-get update && apt-get install libdart6-dev (should bring dart6 from our repository)

I’m still unsure about what is apt going to do in a system if we add the changes in this PR and the system also have dart PPA installed but in the worst case should prevent your error.

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
Not necessarily. It depends on how we want to manage the packages.

The use of a plugin framework means that `ignition-physics` itself is not dependent on the ABI of dart. The only thing that's impacted when dart changes its ABI \(or even changes its API\) is the `ignition-physics-dartsim` plugin. Nothing about the core `ignition-physics` needs to be changed to accommodate upstream changes in dart.

If we're able/willing to rebuild and re-release `ignition-physics-dartsim` specifically for new minor versions of dart, then there's no need to change the version number of `ignition-physics` or re-release it.

In theory, we could even have an extra version on the `ignition-physics-dartsim` plugin, for example: `ignition-physics1-dartsim6_8` could refer to a dart 6.8 plugin that targets `ignition-physics1`. Unfortunately adding an extra version to the `dartsim` plugin wouldn’t help very much since only one minor version of dart can be installed at any given time. We could consider making some upstream changes to dart to allow multiple minor versions to be installed side-by-side. That’s not very common practice, but it might make sense considering the current versioning policy doesn’t give regard to ABI compatibility.
content.html:
Not necessarily. It depends on how we want to manage the packages.

The use of a plugin framework means that ignition-physics itself is not dependent on the ABI of dart. The only thing that's impacted when dart changes its ABI (or even changes its API) is the ignition-physics-dartsim plugin. Nothing about the core ignition-physics needs to be changed to accommodate upstream changes in dart.

If we're able/willing to rebuild and re-release ignition-physics-dartsim specifically for new minor versions of dart, then there's no need to change the version number of ignition-physics or re-release it.

In theory, we could even have an extra version on the ignition-physics-dartsim plugin, for example: ignition-physics1-dartsim6_8 could refer to a dart 6.8 plugin that targets ignition-physics1. Unfortunately adding an extra version to the dartsim plugin wouldn’t help very much since only one minor version of dart can be installed at any given time. We could consider making some upstream changes to dart to allow multiple minor versions to be installed side-by-side. That’s not very common practice, but it might make sense considering the current versioning policy doesn’t give regard to ABI compatibility.

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw: I think one approach would be to move the dartsim plugin to a separate repository so it can be tagged and released independently of the core ign-physics code?
content.html: I think one approach would be to move the dartsim plugin to a separate repository so it can be tagged and released independently of the core ign-physics code?

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
If putting it in its own repo helps with packaging, then that's a perfectly fine option. `ignition-physics` won’t care if the plugin in the same repo or a different one.

The only downside is it means those two repos need to be kept in sync as new features get added across both.
content.html:
If putting it in its own repo helps with packaging, then that's a perfectly fine option. ignition-physics won’t care if the plugin in the same repo or a different one.

The only downside is it means those two repos need to be kept in sync as new features get added across both.

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
If the DART PPA is installed \(option1 and option2 in my previous comment\), apt is unable to handle the installation to get the dart6 6.7.2 packages from our repository and refuses to install:

```
(bionic)jrivero@nium sources.list.d $ sudo apt-get install libignition-physics-dartsim-dev 
Reading package lists... Done
Building dependency tree       
Reading state information... Done
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libignition-physics-dartsim-dev : Depends: libdart6-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
                                   Depends: libdart6-collision-ode-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
                                   Depends: libdart6-utils-urdf-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
```

This will make the incompatible the blueprint installation together with the DART PPA presence. For these cases the workaround of having the preference file is still working and blueprint can be installed together with the DART PPA:

```
/etc/apt/preferences.d/dart:

Package: libdart6*
Pin: origin packages.osrfoundation.org
Pin-Priority: 1001
```

If the DART PPA is installed (option1 and option2 in my previous comment), apt is unable to handle the installation to get the dart6 6.7.2 packages from our repository and refuses to install:

(bionic)jrivero@nium sources.list.d $ sudo apt-get install libignition-physics-dartsim-dev 
Reading package lists... Done

requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.

                                   Depends: libdart6-collision-ode-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
                                   Depends: libdart6-utils-urdf-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed

This will make the incompatible the blueprint installation together with the DART PPA presence. For these cases the workaround of having the preference file is still working and blueprint can be installed together with the DART PPA:

/etc/apt/preferences.d/dart:

Package: libdart6*
Pin: origin packages.osrfoundation.org
Pin-Priority: 1001

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw:
I just tested the following:

* remove all dart6 and ignition-physics debs
* add the DART PPA
* try to install `libignition-physics*`
* didn't change the apt preferences

I get the following error:

~~~
Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libignition-physics-dartsim-dev : Depends: libdart6-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
                                   Depends: libdart6-collision-ode-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
                                   Depends: libdart6-utils-urdf-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.
~~~

so it seems like this change will make the ignition-physics debs incompatible with the PPA
content.html:
I just tested the following:

  • remove all dart6 and ignition-physics debs
  • add the DART PPA
  • try to install libignition-physics*
  • didn't change the apt preferences

I get the following error:

Some packages could not be installed. This may mean that you have
requested an impossible situation or if you are using the unstable
distribution that some required packages have not yet been created
or been moved out of Incoming.
The following information may help to resolve the situation:

The following packages have unmet dependencies:
 libignition-physics-dartsim-dev : Depends: libdart6-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
                                   Depends: libdart6-collision-ode-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
                                   Depends: libdart6-utils-urdf-dev (< 6.8.0) but 6.8.4-1829~201905081333~ubuntu18.04.1 is to be installed
E: Unable to correct problems, you have held broken packages.

so it seems like this change will make the ignition-physics debs incompatible with the PPA

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw: that may be what we need to do, but I think we'll have to document it somewhere in case people run into this problem
content.html: that may be what we need to do, but I think we'll have to document it somewhere in case people run into this problem

pullrequest.title: Force dart dependencies to be lower than 6.8.0

content.raw: let's do it and tell them they have to build from source if they use the dart PPA
content.html: let's do it and tell them they have to build from source if they use the dart PPA
